title: VA - Go Go Power@320
description:
From Bobby McClure&#039;s Northern stomp on "Peak Of Love" to the hard arse funky R &#039;n B of Little Milton&#039;s adaptation of Willie John&#039;s "All Around The World" as "Grit&#039;s Aint Groceries", this album takes aim directly at your feet. 

There&#039;s the breakbeat intro to Sugar Pie DeSanto and Etta James "In The Basement". Jackie Ross&#039; soulful sweetness on her cover of Evie Sands &#039;Take Me For A Little While", and Etta James&#039;s frighteningly deep vocal on the wonderful "Mellow Fellow", and "7Day Fool". 
However there are two reasons why this album needs to exist: Terry Callier&#039;s first cadet single "Look At Me Now", an obscure piece of soul magic, lost by Terry, forgotten by most until it was unearthed sometime in the mid eighties. A vital introduction to to one of the greatest voices in soul music, from who so little is at present available.  What a voice!
The final paragraph must be saved for the diva of this show; Sugar Pie DeSanto a former member of fames Brown&#039;s revue who recorded some of the best female R&#039;n&#039;B records ever. Included here are two duets with Etta fames, the major R&#039;n &#039;B hit "I Don t Wanna Fuss" and the obscure but brilliant "Go Go Power".  (From the Liner Notes)
